title: Famous Munich river wave gone after clean-up | ABC NEWS
description: Following the annual clean-up of Munich's rivers and channels, the city has suddenly found itself without one of its icons. The popular surf spot, the Eisbach has failed to form again after water from its feeder river, the Isar, was let back in following a clean-up in late October. Original reporting by Reuters. Social version by David Douglas Stuart for the ABC NEWS Social Media Team.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: John Barron's take on the US 'off-year' elections | ABC NEWS
description: Donald Trump was not on the ballot in the 2025 'off-year' elections, but Planet America's John Barron says the results do represent a shift against the US President. New York voters have elected 34-year-old Zohran Mamdani as the city's next mayor, while the Democrats have also performed well in other contests. John Barron also reflects on the resignation of senior Democrat Nancy Pelosi from Congress at the age of 85. title: Residents say poor mobile phone reception is leaving lives at risk in regional Tasmania | ABC NEWS
description: Residents in central Tasmania are concerned poor reception and mobile black spots mean they won't always be able to contact triple-0 when they need to. Emergency service members say there have been times when they could not contact people in an emergency. title: Japan's record wave of bear attacks | ABC NEWS
description: Japan has deployed troops to the northern town of Kazuno to help trap bears after an unprecedented wave of attacks.  There have been more than 100 bear attacks and a record 12 people killed across Japan since April.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Fri Fix: Phoebe Litchfield, Mark Wood and an Ashes scene setter
description: Phoebe Litchfield on pain and glory at the World Cup and what comes next for a team theoretically in transition. English quick Mark Wood answers questions on sledging. Emma Lawrence unpacks how the rebooted Ashes has or hasn't changed international rugby league. Featured: Phoebe Litchfield, Australia batter. Emma Lawrence, NRL reporter, Channel Nine.Â    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: New NT Police anti-racism strategy to drive cultural reform | ABC NEWS
description: It took the high-profile coronial into the police shooting death of a young man in Yuendumu to expose the ugly side of racism in the Northern Territory Police Force. Now, after an internal investigation, the verdict is in.   The force's very first anti-racism strategy has been released, but with a Chief Minister in denial about systemic racism in the ranks, will strategy succeed at driving reform? Eleni Roussos has this report for Stateline NT.  Read more: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-07/nt-police-culture-racism-leanne-liddle-interview-stateline/105971332 Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Sussan Ley stares down leadership speculation | ABC NEWS
description: The federal opposition leader has been forced to fend off another round of leadership speculation after one of her backbenchers lashed out at the state of the party, declaring it's the worst she's ever seen. Liberal MPs lined up to insist there's no imminent leadership challenge against Sussan Ley, but Victorian senator Sarah Henderson says the leader is losing support. It's ratchetted up pressure ahead of Ms Ley's biggest test next week, as political lead David Speers explains. title: Australian Carbon Credit Units gain value, Macquarie shares tumble | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: As discussions on net-zero targets continue, the value of carbon credit units is rising due to stricter regulations. Meanwhile, at Tesla's annual general meeting in Texas, shareholders approved a record CEO compensation package for Elon Musk. Macquarie's shares dropped 5.7 per cent to $204.77 after reporting a half-year net profit of $1.7 billion, missing analyst forecasts. title: Potential trillion-dollar payday for Musk approved by Tesla shareholders | ABC NEWS
description: Tesla shareholders have approved a pay package for CEO Elon Musk that could reach $1 trillion. title: Flourishing illicit tobacco trade cost the economy $4b in one year | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's rapidly-growing illicit tobacco trade has become one of the nation's most violent criminal markets, costing the economy billions of dollars each year. The lucrative trade has funded organsied crime activity across the country as syndicates recycle their proceeds. Industry experts say the government's steep tobacco excise is to blame for turning market conditions into a 'smuggler's paradise'. title: Gambling advertisements 'grooming' young children, Tim Costello argues | ABC NEWS
description: The federal government is facing intense lobbying from broadcast television networks as Communication Minister Anika Wells reignites gambling reform talks. It comes two years after the release of the Labor-led 'Murphy report', which recommended a comprehensive ban of online gambling advertisements. Gambling reform advocate Reverend Tim Costello says the government has a moral responsibility to enact the advertising ban to protect children from being 'groomed' into gambling addiction. title: Court hears medical concerns 'brushed aside' before NT death in custody | ABC News
description: A coronial inquest, into the death in custody of Darwin man Wayne Hunt last year, has heard prison officers ignored concerns about a "comatose" prisoner being placed in a cell alone after suffering a seizure.
